alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 4:42AM CST until March 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Turkey River at Garber affecting Clayton County. Turkey River at Elkader affecting Clayton County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows are high and have reached critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey River at Elkader. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs in areas near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM CST Tuesday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.3 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 03/23/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM CST.
